comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.21) Gecko/20110830 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.21
Build ID: 20110830191619

Steps to reproduce:

Open website (on which I'm working). Zoom in and out. Change the font sizes in stylesheet. Open new tab, force reload.


Actual results:

The old zoom levels persist. This makes it a bit tricky to be really sure I'm seeing what the CSS is supposed to do!


Expected results:

When I force-reload a page, it should understand I want to throw away any saved state about the page-zoom.

The feature of saving default zoom levels as a persistent, per-site preference is an excellent one. 

However, Ctrl-Shift-R really does mean "give me the entire site from scratch, discard the cache, get the css and images again". I think that this also implies that I want to throw away the saved zoom level. 
i.e an implicit Ctrl-0.
comments.author: rn214@richardneill.org
comments.creator: rn214@richardneill.org
